215580: This is a categorized overview of available quests. Quests are divided into village-specific and global tasks, each with multiple levels to complete. Rewards vary from resources, hero experience, troops and hero items. Reward is added immediately on collection.
243263: Wounded troops cannot fight and do not consume crop.
642881: Loyalty automatically increases over time when a Residence exists in the village.
650518: Enable notification on Academy research completion
780855: A village can occupy an oasis if it attacks the oasis and subdues all the animals that are present. The attack must also include a hero, who must survive the attack. The oasis will only be captured if there is a level 10, 15 or 20 hero's mansion built in the attacking village, and can still have an empty oasis slot (1 on level 10, 2 on level 15 and 3 on level 20).
794579: This game world is already opened in another tab or browser window.
941963: The limit depends on gameworld speed and can be found in the Culture Points table of the game versions overview.
2c57df: {{buildingName}} does not yet exist in this village
2aea26: A paginated list of player sorted by total population of all their villages.
f858c9: A paginated list of villages sorted by population.
d4a253: A potent blend brewed for berserk fury. Your warriors march with unmatched aggression, gaining +20% attack power. But in their drunken rage, catapult no longer aim accurately and chiefs lose 50% of their persuasive edge
4ea04b: A refined brew favored by chieftains. Grants a modest +5% attack boost, sharpens tongues for loyalty speeches, but leaves catapult operators too cheerful to aim straight.
48897a: A strong ale that stirs courage without clouding aim. Your armies gain a solid +10% attack, while siege weapons remain steady. Chiefs, however, still stumble over their words, reducing their effectiveness by 50%.
3d72f3: A village's loyalty cannot decrease as long as the Residence exists in the village. If Residence does not exist, loyalty can be reduced by attacks with administrators. Once loyalty reaches 0%, the village is conquered.
13ec45: Ability points can be used to improve your hero. Hero starts their journey with 4 ability points. Each time a hero gains a level they earn 4 additional ability points that can be used to increase any of the four abilities. Each ability can only be increased a hundred times.
0c82d5: Academy is already busy researching a different unit.
641b3f: Auctions are used to buy and sell hero items with silver. They're a reliable way to obtain useful equipment or consumables when you need them.
3700af: Bandages do not affect how many troops become wounded.
6a07a3: Both infantry and cavalry use the same queue.
56de45: Browse and bid on hero items using silver. Find equipment or consumables that fit your needs.
1d9b57: Building can't be downgraded or demolished while it's being upgraded.
e010e2: Building can't be upgraded any further
95bf42: Building is not fully implemented, some functionality may be missing.
29b890: Buildings focused on improving village economy.
4863bd: Buildings focused on providing village services, growth and utility. They generally support administration and logistics rather than producing raw resources.
9c6be6: Buildings focused on raising, upgrading and supporting armed forces and village defense. This category covers training, unit production, upgrades and defensive capabilities that increase a village’s combat effectiveness.
c5b92b: Buy resources from nearby players and filter offers to match your needs. Select the resource you're searching for by clicking its button. The same applies when choosing what you want to offer.
3f670e: Catapult may only target random buildings
420e0f: Catapult retain ability to target specific buildings
3c4912: Certain hero items may further increase loyalty.

ca142f: Culture Points gained equals the daily Culture Points production of all your villages, up to the limit.
bf0a71: Culture Points gained equals the daily Culture Points production of the village, up to the celebration limit.
2b9fc3: Define your criteria and click search.
ccb40a: Disables certain animations and effects for a smoother experience.
119ccc: Each celebration triggers a cooldown before the next one can start.
96f4a0: Each celebration type has a maximum number of Culture Points it can generate.
e70613: Each level of the Residence increases loyalty by 2% every three hours, up to a maximum of 100%.

8ef2f4: Enable notification on building upgrade completion
e083a0: Enable notification on Smithy unit upgrade completion
ce1638: Enables accessibility enhancements for better usability.
a019cd: Enables instant building of buildings and troops with no cost.
d43454: Every village begins with 100% loyalty. Loyalty determines how firmly a village belongs to your realm. When loyalty drops to 0%, the village will switch allegiance and become part of the attacker's realm.
1135af: For an oasis to be occupiable, it has to be in a radius of 3 squares around your village. To successfully occupy an oasis, you have to have an empty oasis slot available.
783fd6: Found a total of {{amount}} tiles that match your criteria.

b0cdc0: Occupied oasis provide a resource production bonus of either 25% or 50% to one or multiple resources. If you choose to abandon an oasis, the abandoned oasis will start to regenerate animals.
9b1a7b: Only units from villages that had a Hospital at the time of the battle can become wounded.
1df23a: Pillage First! (Ask Questions Later) is a single-player, real-time, browser-based strategy game inspired by Travian. Manage resources to construct buildings, train units, and wage war against your enemies. Remember: pillage first, ask questions later!
ea9788: Queued celebrations continue and will start after cooldown ends.
2c8d8e: Rename current village. Name cannot exceed 30 characters.
8e8646: Review your recent auctions — see what you've bought, sold, and how much silver was exchanged.
06bce8: Search for villages that offer your desired resources and oasis bonuses.
28868e: Select a daytime or nighttime setting to adjust the overall visual atmosphere.
244ac7: Select a light or dark theme for the interface appearance.
14ecab: Select the amount of units to train
8a1667: Select the type and number of units to train. Once queued, units will be trained one at a time, in the order you queued them in.
0c2d54: Select whether enemies can trigger attacks against you while you're offline.
a7e7cb: Settlers are already on route to this location
af9607: Shows the names of buildings on village and resources views.
d35f45: Siege engines, settlers, administrators and heroes cannot become wounded.
0ffc05: Tasty mead is brewed in the brewery and later quaffed by the soldiers during their celebrations. These drinks make your soldiers braver and stronger when attacking others. Different brews served cause different effects on your troops.
1c195d: The exact cooldown duration depends on the Town Hall level and server speed.
2ce55c: The game world you are trying to open does not exist.
d7f9ac: The Hero is your strongest unit. It can be improved and equipped with powerful items. The Hero does not need to be researched or trained and is available from the start. The hero can attack or defend like other units, but is the only one who can go on adventures for loot and conquer oases for bonus resources.
6d41e2: The Hospital allows you to treat wounded troops so they can rejoin your army. This helps you recover faster after major battles. Healing troops is not cheaper than training new ones, the resource cost is the same, but healing takes half the time of normal training.
4c2f09: The Hospital has its own healing queue, similar to the Barracks or Stable.
fadfab: The Hospital heals units twice as fast as training in Barracks or Stable of the same level.
b13840: The main building is the administrative center of your village. From here, you can rename your village and manage its infrastructure. If needed, you can also demolish existing buildings to make room for new development or restructure your layout.
82e3ed: The smithy improves the attack and defence values of troops by 1.5% per upgrade. Only researched units can be improved. Upgrades are limited by current smithy level, up to max level of 20. If you choose to demolish your smithy, you will not lose the upgrades to your troops. Each smithy can only work on 1 upgrade at the time, but multiple smithies may work on multiple level upgrades for the same unit at the same time.
775b87: The Town Hall allows you to hold celebrations, which instantly grant Culture Points. Upgrading the Town Hall reduces the cooldown time between celebrations, allowing you to generate Culture Points more frequently.
48e4d5: There are currently no troops in this village
018331: There are no more artifacts to conquer.
a4b414: These loyalty effects apply to all battles that take place during the celebration, regardless of when troops were sent.
4abab8: These quests are not tied to any village and are progress in all villages.
1c0d15: These quests are tied to the current village and can only be progressed in current village.
8918f5: This game world may have been removed or the address is incorrect. Please check the server list or return to the game overview.
24659a: This is a categorized view of archived reports. These reports are not deleted once a limit is reached and you can have an unlimited amount of them. You can toggle different types of reports by using report filters below.

14b738: This is a categorized view of in-game reports. You can toggle different types of reports by using report filters below.
59d8bd: This is an occupiable oasis. You can occupy this oasis by upgrading {{herosMansion}} to levels 10, 15 or 20.
8f51af: This oasis is occupied by another player. You can raid it, but doing so may trigger retaliations.

bdf6df: This section provides detailed information about building upgrades, including the resource costs and the time required to reach each level. Use the tabs below to explore how upgrades impact both your economy and strategy.

18e599: To be able to train stronger units, you will need to do research in your academy. The more this building is upgraded, the more you will have access to advanced research.
e88cc0: To prevent data corruption, only a single instance of each game world is allowed to be open at once. Please close the other tab or window, then proceed to refresh the app.
65fb0d: Troops that die while escaping from traps do not become wounded.

04c61c: Village overview allows you to track active troop training, smithy and academy queues, monitor merchant availability and movements and track ongoing celebrations.
e23a52: When a village has a Hospital, 40% of its losses in any battle return as wounded troops.
aaef8d: While in vacation mode, game pauses completely. You may enable vacation mode or resume gameplay at any time.
4d7d77: With a level 10 {{mainBuilding}} you are able to downgrade or demolish a building. You cannot downgrade or demolish buildings which are currently being upgraded.
9fa55e: Wounded troops continue decaying at the usual 10% per day.
ac09a5: Wounded units that are not being healed die gradually at a rate of 10% per day. As soon as a wounded unit enters the healing queue, it stops decaying.
ccc346: You can establish a new village on this tile. To settle it, make sure you have 3 settlers and an unused expansion slot from one of your villages.
